intro: Ruellia epallocaulos, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers in terminal spikes, which bloom from summer to fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Ruellia epallocaulos is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display.
